page.title: 10ASTLEY PARISH CHURCH
page.content:
The church was rebuilt in 1343 at the expense of Thomas de Astley.It was a cruciform building with a central tower and spire and was known as the "Lanthern of Arden" as travellers could pick out a light hung on the spire to guide them.The church was also to be a college for several priests and these buildings were to the north east of the present church site. After the Dissolution of church colleges the property at Astley reverted to the current lords of the manor and Adrian Stokes plundered the buildings for materials including demolishing the spire and stripping the lead form the roof in 1558.
